poem:
Title: "A Song of Silent Sorrow"

In the valley's lap, a hope sown,
A Welsh post's quiet life, unadorned.
Snowdonia's slopes whispered to the man alone,
His dreams in rustic stillness formed.

Yet technology, the hungry beast,
Gnawed at peace with relentless feast.
Dreams crumbled, innocence lost:
A quiet life pays the cost.

Yet, a spark kindled, a drama unfurled,
A hope for justice in a weary world.
